IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE PRIMARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION THROUGH A DEMANDING CURRICULUM AND VIBRANT CIVIC LIFE TO STUDENTS FROM PRESCHOOL THROUGH GRADE 12, WHERE DEVOTED TEACHERS CHALLENGE AND ENGAGE TALENTED STUDENTS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: A PASSION FOR LEARNING IS AT THE HEART OF BERKELEY CARROLL. THE SCHOOL IS A CREATIVE AND INTELLECTUAL COMMUNITY WHERE DEVOTED TEACHERS CHALLENGE AND ENGAGE TALENTED STUDENTS. OUR DEMANDING CURRICULUM AND VIBRANT CIVIC LIFE PREPARE OUR DIVERSE GRADUATES FOR SUCCESS IN COLLEGE AND FOR THE GREATER ENDEAVOR - A LIFE OF CRITICAL, ETHICAL, AND GLOBAL THINKING.
IRS990.Desc: THE BERKELEY CARROLL SCHOOL PROVIDES PRIMARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION TO ITS STUDENTS FROM PRESCHOOL THROUGH TWELFTH GRADE. THE SCHOOL HAD 979 STUDENTS IN THE FY 2017/2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE SCHOOL OFFERS TWO SUMMER PROGRAMS THAT RUN FROM JULY THROUGH AUGUST OF EACH YEAR. EACH PROGRAM HAD APPROXIMATELY 200-620 CHILDREN IN THE FY 2017/2018 YEAR.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE SCHOOL OPERATES AN ATHLETIC CENTER THAT OFFERS AFTERSCHOOL AND WEEKEND GYM AND SWIMMING CLASSES TO ITS STUDENTS AND THE COMMUNITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT IS TO BE USED FOR PROVIDING FINANCIAL AID FOR NEED BASED STUDENTS, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR FACULTY AND STAFF, AND TO SUPPORT OTHER INSTRUCTIONAL PROGRAMS.

THE SCHOOL RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE SCHOOL HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE. THE SCHOOL IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO JUNE 30, 2015.
RENTAL EXPENSES REPORTED ON PART VIII LINE 6B 903,221. UNREALIZED GAIN ON INTEREST RATE SWAP 1,087,070.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID NETTED AGAINST REVENUE 6,848,579.
RENTAL EXPENSES REPORTED ON PART VIII LINE 6B 903,221.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID NETTED AGAINST REVENUE 6,848,579.

THE SCHOOL PUBLISHES ITS NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY IN ALL ARENAS THAT THE SCHOOL ADVERTISES DURING ITS ADMISSIONS SEASON. THE SCHOOL ALSO ANNUALLY PUBLISHES ITS NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY IN THE EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK AND STUDENT PARENT HANDBOOK AND POSTS THE POLICY ON ITS WEBSITE.
THE SCHOOL RECEIVES AN ANNUAL GRANT FROM THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION BASED ON THE ATTENDANCE OF THE SCHOOL BODY. (MANDATED AID)

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BCS SHALL PAY CCS A TOTAL FEE OF $136,000. THE CCS SERVICE FEE IS PAYABLE IN MONTHLY INSTALLMENTS AS FOLLOWS: - JULY 15, 2017 $18,500 - SEPTEMBER 15, 2017 $23,000 - OCTOBER 15, 2017 $23,000 - NOVEMBER 15, 2017 $23,000 - DECEMBER 15, 2017 $23,000 - JANUARY 15, 2018 $13,000 - FEBRUARY 15, 2018 $2,500 - MARCH 15, 2018 $2,500 - APRIL 15, 2018 $2,500 - MAY 15, 2018 $2,500 - JUNE 15, 2018 $2,500

STUDENT AID IS AWARDED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BASED ON THE NEED OF THE FAMILY. THE FOLLOWING PROCEDURES ARE FOLLOWED WHEN GRANTING AID: PARENTS START THE APPLICATION PROCESS BY SUBMITTING AN APPLICATION TO TADS (TUITION AID DATA SERVICES) WHICH PROVIDES AN INDEPENDENT OPINION OF AN APPROPRIATE NEED BASED AWARD AMOUNT TO THE SCHOOL. THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE THEN REVIEWS THE APPLICATION AND OTHER RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION, ALONG WITH THE RECOMMENDATION BY TADS AND DETERMINES THE FINANCIAL AID AMOUNT TO BE AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT. ONCE AID IS GRANTED, THE AID IS APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ENROLLMENT CONTRACT AND ANY OTHER AUXILIARY SERVICES, REDUCING THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF TUITION AND/OR AUXILIARY SERVICES TO BE PAID FOR BY THE FAMILY FOR THE SCHOOL YEAR.

THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, ROBERT VITALO, SHALL MAINTAIN A RESIDENCE IN PARK SLOPE, BROOKLYN WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF THE SCHOOL. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL RECEIVED AN ANNUAL HOUSING ALLOWANCE PAYABLE MONTHLY, IN THE AMOUNT OF $70,000 DURING 2017 INCLUDED IN HIS W-2. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL ALSO RECEIVED GROSS-UP PAYMENT OF $14,004 DURING 2017 INCLUDED IN HIS W-2 FOR EXCESS RETIREMENT CONTRIBUTIONS.
THE ROBERT VITALO PARTICIPATES IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NON-QUALIFIED PLAN. THE ORGANIZATION CONTRIBUTED $90,000 TO ROBERT VITALO'S 457(F) PLAN DURING 2017.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: PROVIDE FUNDS TO REFUND PRIOR ISSUE AND ALSO CONSTRUCT SCHOOL BUILDINGS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COLUMN (B) REPORTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, COO AND HEAD OF SCHOOL FOR ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS. THEN, A COPY OF THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS POSTED TO DILIGENT (BOARD DOCUMENT SOFTWARE) FOR REVIEW BY THE ENTIRE BOARD. COMMENTS AND REVIEWS ARE THEN FORWARDED BY EMAIL TO THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, COO AND HEAD OF SCHOOL WHERE EDITS ARE ADDRESSED. A REVISED COPY IS THEN PROVIDED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS FOR APPROVAL AT THE BOARD MEETING BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO ALL EMPLOYEES, OFFICERS AND TRUSTEES OF THE SCHOOL. THE CHIEF OPERATIONS OFFICER AND THE DIRECTORS OF FINANCE ROUTINELY REVIEW ALL VENDOR CONTRACTS FOR ALL MATERIAL ITEMS, INCLUDING POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THE POLICY IS DETAILED IN THE EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK, AND ALL EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN AN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT ANNUALLY OF ALL POLICIES, INCLUDING THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. IN ADDITION, ALL TRUSTEES SUBMIT WRITTEN STATEMENTS ANNUALLY THAT THEY ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE POLICY. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT INVOLVING AN EMPLOYEE WOULD BE BROUGHT TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. IF THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT INVOLVED THE HEAD OF SCHOOL OR A TRUSTEE, THE MATTER WOULD BE BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. A PERSON WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST MAY MAKE A PRESENTATION AT A BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING, BUT AFTER THE PRESENTATION, HE/SHE SHALL LEAVE THE MEETING DURING THE DISCUSSION OF, AND VOTE ON, THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT INVOLVING THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IN ADDITION, ONLY PERSONS WHO ARE INDEPENDENT TRUSTEES AS DEFINED IN THE BYLAWS MAY VOTE ON THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: HEAD OF SCHOOL: WHENEVER AN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS PREPARED, AN AD HOC COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS FORMED. IN ADDITION, AN INDEPENDENT CONSULTANT IS HIRED TO PROVIDE INDEPENDENT RESEARCH AND COMPARABILITY DATA. THE SCHOOL'S LAW FIRM GETS INVOLVED IN PROVIDING THE EXACT LANGUAGE FOR THE CONTRACT, AMOUNTS AND METHODS OF COMPENSATION. APPROVAL FOR THIS PROCESS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MINUTES. REVIEW OF THIS POLICY WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2016. ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES: ALL OTHER EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS ARE DETERMINED BY THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL, WHO, REFERS TO THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS AND MARKET COMPARABILITY DATA WHEN DECIDING ALL COMPENSATION. APPROVAL OF THIS POLICY IS DOCUMENTED IN THE FINANCE AND BOARD MINUTES. REVIEW OF THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AND FORM 1023 AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AS REQUIRED UNDER SECTION 6104 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IT IS POSTED ON GUIDESTAR.ORG AND OTHER SIMILAR TYPES OF WEBSITES. IN ADDITION, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST AT 152 STERLING PLACE, BROOKLYN, NY 11217 OR BY CALLING THE ORGANIZATION DIRECTLY AT 718-534-6579.
UNREALIZED GAIN ON INTEREST RATE SWAP 1,087,070. LOSS ON UNCOLLECTIBLE PLEDGE -5,500.

THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
